occurrences.text: them the instruction that they're to follow. And then you find that the Bible tells us as the Lord commanded Moses, repeated seven times, and you find that they did it. They did the work. They did what God called them to do. And you come to verse number 34. And in Exodus chapter 40 and verse number 34, it starts with a word then. Then. The word then is an interesting word because it means after something. After the Lord commanded and after they did according to what the Lord commanded then. Then does not come if they don't do. Would you agree? We never read the end of Exodus 40 if they don't do as the Lord commanded them to do. What is accomplished? What is it when we think about this truth of serving the Lord and we recognize what is accomplished when we serve the Lord? We've already noted their attitude. We've understood that God's given them the ability and we find what is accomplished. Well, because they did the work, we're able to read the end of Exodus when the Bible says, then a cloud covered the tent of the congregation and the glory of the Lord filled the tabernacle. Verse 35, and Moses were not able to enter into the tent of the congregation. Why? Because the cloud abode thereon and the glory of the Lord filled the tabernacle. I hope that you'd agree
